WorkItem.Description:
I know you have the beta now, that's nice, but it pops up every single time i open rawr to remind me.  I just upgraded hoping 2.3.14 would stop this, but alas....
Â 
I'm running rawr under mono (on linux) if that's the problem, maybe you did intend to have it show only once and it's just buggy under this alternate environment.  (also, fwiw, not too happy v3 is in silverlight)
WorkItem.Summary: popup about the beta won't stop

Comments.Message: Yeah, we tried to make that popup only popup once for 2.3.14, but failed. We'll get it working (only once!) in 2.3.15.

ah ok, suppose that's decent then.  Might I table the proposition of having no popups?  Popups are very annoying.  

While we're on the subject, the "welcome" popup is more of a hindrance than a help as well (also due to mono problems, but i could say the same when i use it normally on windows)  Why can't rawr just start, without a splash screen and without any popup notification or "intro" window?
(sorry to double post, i know there's the "show start page" checkbox, but it's hard to find b/c mono is rendering that start page badly, however, it also fails to affect the behavior)
If someone would post Mono corrective patches, we would apply them. Otherwise Mono will stay broken as we don't have Mono devs.

I understand that beta 3 is great news but I, alot like the original poster wish to supress the window from always popping up. It's been there since 2.3.13/14 and was supposed to be removed. Any word on this as we're already on 2.3.15
